item.title: Managing Systemd Targets and Working with GRUB2
item.description: Managing Systemd Targets A Systemd target is a group of units belonging together, some of these targets can be used to define the state a system should boot in. These targets can be isolated and have the AllowIsolate property in their [Unit] section. Four targets can be used to boot into: emergency.target : A minimal number of units are started. rescue.target : A fully operation Linux system without nonessential services.
